meanings.definition: To dye (a fabric) again with a different color.
meanings.sent1: She decided to overdyed her old shirt to give it a fresh look.
meanings.sent2: The tailor overdyed the dress to change its color from blue to green.
meanings.sent3: The fabric was overdyed with a vibrant red, making it stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent4: He overdyed the curtains, transforming them into a bold statement piece.
meanings.sent5: The artist overdyed the canvas, creating a masterpiece of blended colors.

meanings.definition: Having been dyed again with a different color.
meanings.sent1: The overdyed scarf caught everyone's attention with its unique hues.
meanings.sent2: She wore an overdyed sweater that had a mix of blue and purple tones.
meanings.sent3: The overdyed hair of the clown made the children giggle with delight.
meanings.sent4: The overdyed fabric resembled a rainbow, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The overdyed jeans had a trendy, modern look that appealed to the younger crowd.
